a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Measured in terawatt-hours of direct primary energy consumption. Traditional biomass refers to the
consumption of fuelwood, forestry products, animal and agricultural wastes.
Data source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2024); Smil (2017)
Note: In the absence of more recent data, traditional biomass is assumed constant since 2015.
